text:

On first glance at Emma Watson arriving to film Jimmy Kimmel Live in LA, you’d think she’s toned down her look after that controversial magazine shoot. 
But on closer inspection, the 26 year old is still flashing a very low cut neckline – and clearly couldn’t care less about critics who called her anti-feminist for posing topless in a recent magazine shoot. 
The Beauty and the Beast actress looked like she meant business in a grey checked suit. 
The oversized suit swamped Emma’s frame – and she went without a top instead flashing her bra to add a feminine edge to her look. Emma Watson goes topless under her grey suit jacket (Photo: WENN) The actress flashed her bra (Photo: WENN) 
She also wore a pair of black strappy heels. 
The former Harry Potter actress wore her hair swept off her face in a stylish updo. 
She wore a slick of red lipstick and sassy hoop earrings. Emma meant business (Photo: WENN) She arrived at the ABC studios for Jimmy Kimmel Live (Photo: WENN) 
Earlier this week, Emma hit back at critics who called her anti-feminist for posing topless in a recent magazine shoot. 
During an interview with co-star Dan Stevens to promote their forthcoming Disney movie, Beauty and the Beast , Emma was asked about the recent controversy surrounding her cover shoot for Vanity Fair. 
In the artistic shot, the star appeared topless with a daringly revealing shawl draped over her shoulders, flashing more flesh than we are used to seeing in Disney princesses. Emma wore strappy heels with the oversized suit (Photo: WENN) 
The bemused star finally addressed th widespread criticism, saying: "It just always reveals to me what a - how many misconceptions there are and misunderstanding there is. 
"Feminism is about giving women choice. Feminism is not a stick with which to beat other women with (sic). 
"It's about freedom. It's about liberation. It's about equality. (Photo: Tim Walker/Vanity Fair) 
"I really don't know what my t*ts have to do with it. It's very confusing. I'm confused. Most people are confused. I'm always just kind of quietly stunned." 
Dan Stevens, who plays the Beast in their upcoming movie, asked her what people were saying about her, to which Emma replied: "They were saying that I couldn't be a feminist and... and have boobs." Like us on Facebook
